page.title: 13Auction Market .1 (M)
page.content:
{The Farmer's Auction Market}
Most of area is rural and we visited the Cattle Market to see what happens to the cattle and sheep which can be seen in the fields. We went on the busiest day which is the last Friday of the month. The busiest time of the year is Autumn. First we saw the sheep being sold in a small semi circular ring. Some men called drovers, hit the sheep with sticks to get them to go round the ring. A man at the front said the prices very quickly and pointed at the farmers with a stick. The farmers bid just by nodding their heads or twitching a finger. The cattle were sold in a bigger ring. They were weighed first. Most of the cattle we saw were British Friesan and the average cost per cow was 600 pounds.
